sentences.english: He had enjoyed sex with 30 imperial concubines in one night.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经一夜间一夜召幸三十嫔妃？

sentences.english: Cixi was sent to the Forbidden City in 1851 to be a concubine to Emperor Xianfeng.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧1851年被送进紫禁城，成为咸丰皇帝的嫔妃。

sentences.english: Philip had many concubines and eventually married one of them.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普有很多的嫔妃，并最终娶了其中一个。

sentences.english: I could hear the wives behind the thick door of our inner room, stirring there.
sentences.chinese: 透过厚实的门板，听得见隔壁房里众嫔妃沙沙的声音。

sentences.english: No less captive within the Forbidden City were the imperial concubines.
sentences.chinese: 紫禁城里最可怜的奴隶是皇帝的嫔妃。

sentences.english: He cooked up a scheme to cheat some of the women in the royal harem.
sentences.chinese: 他伪造名单诱骗了一些后宫嫔妃。

sentences.english: Furthermore, she never used her position to indulge in extravagances or covetously harm the emperor's concubines.
sentences.chinese: 更不曾以自己的地位，而奢侈浮华，或妒害嫔妃。

sentences.english: Why can you have 4 concubines, 121 talent ladies, and a thousand maids?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能有四个嫔妃，一百二十一个才人，成千的宫女？

sentences.english: Buried there are the remains of five emperors, their wives and other royal family members.
sentences.chinese: 葬在那里的是五位皇帝，其嫔妃及其他皇室成员。

definition: imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
